summary: The UK government is actively engaging with stakeholders following the closure of a formal consultation on AI regulation, which ended on June 21, 2023. The National AI Strategy emphasizes a pro-innovation approach to governing AI, aiming to create a regulatory framework that supports growth and public trust. The UK Science and Technology Framework identifies AI as a critical technology and outlines the government's vision to position the UK as a leader in AI by 2030. The government is currently analyzing feedback from the consultation to refine its proposals.
takeaways: The formal consultation on AI regulation closed on June 21, 2023.
The UK government aims to develop a pro-innovation framework for AI regulation.
AI is identified as one of five critical technologies in the UK Science and Technology Framework.
The government is analyzing feedback from the consultation to inform future regulatory proposals.
The strategy aims to strengthen the UK's position as a global leader in AI by 2030.
